description: Adobe Dreamweaver Creative Cloud is used by web designers and front-end developers and allows you to visualize your site in real-time as you code. Its design surface combines with integration of Bootstrap and code editor and integrates robust site management tools for easy design, code, and management of websites and mobile content. This course covers exam objectives for the Adobe Certified Associate (ACA) certification.
name: Dreamweaver CC
subtitle: Web Design Application

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim discuss the basics of DreamWeaver. They explain preferences, the Welcome screen, history and customizing the Workspace. They look at panels including docking, collapsing, groups and creating new layouts.
episodes.title: Introduction to Dreamweaver

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim demonstrate how to create a new site inside of DreamWeaver. They explore configuring appropriate folders for all site files, version control and the Files panel. They talk about naming conventions to organize content, tips to help make the user more productive and efficient.
episodes.title: Creating a Site in Dreamweaver

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim show the viewer how to create a new page. They discuss HTML characteristics such as tags, elements, attributes and values. They explain HTML structure such as the header, body and doctype. They explore using HTLM5 structure such as headers, navs, mains, sections, articles and footers.
episodes.title: Creating a Page in Dreamweaver

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim discuss styling with Cascading Style Sheets. They talk about the three different styles including internal/embedded, external and inline. They introduce selectors such as classes, IDs and tags and well as the CSS Designer panel.
episodes.title: Styling with CSS

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim discuss the characteristics of common images uses inside of websites today. They talk look at the Graphic Interchange Format, Joint Photographic Experts Group and the Portable Network Graphic file formats and their usages. They demonstrate how to insert an image within the website and the Assets Panel.
episodes.title: Inserting Images

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim take a look at inserting links within the website. They discuss link types such as internal, external, incoming as well as their purpose when using them. They look at link concepts such as absolute paths, document-relative paths and site root-relative paths.
episodes.title: Inserting Links

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim demonstrate inserting multimedia files into the website. They explain the different audio file types such as MP3, OGG and WAV as well as browser compatibility for these files. They discuss different video files MP4, OGG, WebM and likewise browser compatibility for these files.
episodes.title: Inserting Multimedia Files

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim demonstrate to the viewer how to create, save and use templates. They discuss regions like editable regions, repeating regions and optional regions. They also take a look at tables and talk about the common usage for them.
episodes.title: Working with Templates and Tables

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim introduce creating forms. They explain the properties of forms like form ID, action, method, target, enctype and class. They also look at various form elements such as text fields, hidden fields, textarea, checkbox groups and more.
episodes.title: Creating Forms

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim walk through several design principles to guide the viewer through best practices such as,knowing who you are design to, copyright and infringement concerns and more.
episodes.title: Principles of Web Design

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim demonstrate how to push the website into production by publishing it. They look at some of the tools that can be used to validate the website, perform link checking and spelling checker.
episodes.title: Publishing Your Site
